website_summaries.verdict: Customers looking to buy a slightly adjustable thatch rake from a reliable brand will find their match in this favored product.
pros: Curved tines are easily able to clean dead grass clippings out of lawn
Head is able to adjust its angle for convenient clearing
cons: More expensive than other adjustable rakes
Plastic tines can break with heavy use

customer_reviews.title: Great dethaching rake!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to remove the majority of my dead crabgrass infested lawn within a few hours to prepare for reseeding. Works well and seems built to last. Rubber grip should be glued on but isn't and slips up occasionally. Use with a good pair of gloves or you will get blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Swan

customer_reviews.title: Effective and exhausting
customer_reviews.text: Does what it’s meant to do, but please believe people who tell you that dethatching manually is exhausting and impractical. This is good for spot work in problematic areas, but don’t think you’re going to do your whole yard with this.
customer_reviews.author: ryesteve

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS TOOL!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS TOOL! I have those annoying weeds that grow all over my lawn. I found this treasure. I rake through the grass and only those annoying weeds are pulled out! I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Dunder

customer_reviews.title: 100% Satisfied.  High Quality.  Works Great.  Keeps Lawns Happy.  Wear Gloves.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews unless something impresses the hell out of me. This thatch rake exceeded my expectations. It is very well made, sturdy, and works great. I was a bit skeptical the tines would snag and tear up my yard. That was not the case. Amazing how much dead grass & thatch it removes. What you see in the pictures took me about 10 minutes. It was time consuming to do the whole yard but will prove to be worthwhile. Wear gloves. Your yard will greatly appreciate it and reward you.
customer_reviews.author: NC Bill

customer_reviews.title: Well built tool that holds together well even under breaking up solidly packed dirt and tossing large piles of tumbleweeds
customer_reviews.text: This was a solid tool that really helped clear out our acre of tumbleweeds that took over our yard this year. It thatches, lifts and most important - holds together for the job. We went thru 3 of these things before we found one that was as solidly made as this one.
customer_reviews.author: MEWTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: This thatch rake works very well. We just moved into a place with a small back yard and the previous tenants did not take care of the lawn. This rake easily helped us remove the patches of thatch so that we could use some new grass seed and get this lawn even again. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra M

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool is sturdy, and gets the job done as it should. I was able to pull tons of that shot of my yard without pulling out much living grass. It seems as though I should have this for a lifetime without it breaking, using it on a small yard.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great for de-thatching and removing weeds such as crabgrass.
customer_reviews.text: I love the variability and overall versatility of this thatch rake. With a light pressure, you can remove thatch without harming your grass. However, adjusting the blade pitch to a steeper angle and using more pressure will allow you to loosen top soil and pull up a few weeds such a crab grass. It’s very well built, sturdy, durable and easy to adjust and use. A recommended buy.
customer_reviews.author: C.B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool! Extremely useful and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe how much thatch and dead grass clippings I’m pulling up out of my yard. This is a great tool! At this moment, I’ve pulled two garbage cans worth of dead crap out of my front yard and one out of the back yard. I’m a new home owner and I inherited a lot of yard problems from the previous owners. After paying for aeration, a liquid aerator, and this thatch take, the problem was clearly the thatch preventing water from getting to the soil. Overnight improvement in soil condition. It’s clearly absorbed water and is much softer this morning than previous mornings. Just be sure you watch a video on how to adjust the rake!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: You need this
customer_reviews.text: This tool is SOLID! This is my second tool from this company I can't sing their praises enough. Very well constructed, will last a lifetime. You should know that this dethatcher does take some strength to use. I'm using it on St. Augustine grass (which is a beast) but man it does the trick. If I were using this on Blue Grass it would be much easier. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GingerStar

customer_reviews.title: Great Thatch rake
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny! This Thatch rake is so easy to use and does the job quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Spartan

customer_reviews.title: Shreds it
customer_reviews.text: This rake shreds tough st augustine thatch!!! I can't do without it!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Toenies II

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: During quarantine i worked my lawn like i had nothing else to do. Its hard work, my back hurt, my hands had blisters in em. I did the whole front yard in 5 days, i got about 25 big trashbags worth of thach. I started early april and today may 16 i can say i have the greenest yard in the neighborhood. Ps wont ever do it again i got an electric dethatcher
customer_reviews.author: Lebron

customer_reviews.title: No complaints. Does exactly what it should.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as expected, easy to use. I have a small yard so I was able to do my whole yard with it in a couple of hours. Adjustable head makes a noticeable difference based on how you set it. I have also used the other side to prepare small patches for gardening. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher DeBose

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect tool for removing thatch manually, without tearing up your sod. It is sturdy but heavy, so I can only do a small section at a time. But, my lawn really perked up because removing the thatch allows fertilizer and seed to reach the soil. I now insist the lawn service bag all the grass all year long; so should you.
customer_reviews.author: BONES

customer_reviews.title: This is one of those things I should have bought 20 years ago!
customer_reviews.text: I have a small lawn and have used a steel rake in the past to thatch it. Wow! This rake requires 1/4 the effort and does the job 10X better. I should have bought this a LONG time ago. Oh well, live and learn I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful, you can and will tear up your yard if you are not careful. Excellent for patch work, large flower beds and creating a pathway/walkway.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use if you don’t mind some labor. Bigger yards recommend getting an electric dethacher!
customer_reviews.author: jose

customer_reviews.title: Better lawn
customer_reviews.text: Word of caution, if you adjust the head make sure the nut on each side is firmly screwed tight as I lost one of mine after a few minutes but luckily found it.
customer_reviews.author: UK gal in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Debris rake
customer_reviews.text: Saw this on YouTube, the YouTube name was PEST AND LAWN GINJA and it works outstanding for soil samples and diagnostic procedures for the lawn, it should be renamed called the debris rake, to see how much debris is in your lawn just above the thatch layer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and perfect to de-thatching
customer_reviews.text: Heavy enough to de-thatch, but not too heavy to handle. The proper length and the adjustable head is easy to use. I had matted Bermuda grass that probably hasn't been de-thatched in 15 years and it broke it up nicely. Great for getting small rocks out of the soil surface too.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and strong rake
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item, really tears through the lawn thatch, even moss, with little effort.. Very well made, well balanced tool. The adjustable head is a great feature for rugged areas or hills.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Smith

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS, stay far away!!
customer_reviews.text: I opened up the package and the smooth wood handled was so full of splintered wood that I cut my hand open on numerous spots THE FIRST TIME I TOUCHED THE HANDLE. I bleed all over the place. Can’t comment on the rest of the quality of the rake because the construction of the handle was so dangerous and poorly inspected. STAY FAR AWAY.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Paulsen

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, especially if your 20 year old son does the work.
customer_reviews.author: Tais

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: world very good and its adjustable it works perfect on my grass for thatching you should get it if your grass needs work
customer_reviews.author: richard watts

customer_reviews.title: AMES 2915100 Adjustable Self-Cleaning Thatch Rake with Hardwood Handle, 61-Inch
customer_reviews.text: AMES 2915100 Adjustable Self-Cleaning Thatch Rake with Hardwood Handle, 61-Inch is a great tool if you can handle the load, it does what it is designed for, but it takes alot out of you. It will gave you a work out and more.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Flores III

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: Ppl suggest renting from HD but I felt it's a good workout. Very good quality. I used this on my entire lawn. Ofcourse tough to do manually but nice.
customer_reviews.author: Rupesh Mohan

customer_reviews.title: Good Job
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. It has strong tines that can help pull out the yellow grass. I returned my electric dethatcher which has nothing to do with the grass but raising a lot of dust. This manual traditional tool is more reliable than a Hi-tech product.
customer_reviews.author: nanhuang

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Small Areas
customer_reviews.text: I thought the rake would be wider. It works great though. I wouldn't recomend doing a big yard, but it's great for small spots.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley & Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job, however
customer_reviews.text: Works great for small areas. However for larger areas it would "forever" to dethatch. Bought the motorized one also.
customer_reviews.author: North Shore Surfer

customer_reviews.title: Great for small yard
customer_reviews.text: Do a good job and give you a work out. It clear out the thatch pretty good
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D

customer_reviews.title: The green way to a greener lawn
customer_reviews.text: What I liked most about the moss rakes its ease of use, with very little effort you get job done and barely break a sweat !the stainless steel tines are easily adjusted for different height user and makes quick work of pulling out the deepest rooted moss while leaving your lawn intact , better than using chemicals to rid your lawn of moss
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Willis

customer_reviews.title: Quality construction!
customer_reviews.text: Well made and versatile. This is great for gardening and small areas. You won’t be disappointed in the quality of this item.
customer_reviews.author: knockitstiff

customer_reviews.title: I will buy it again but mine still working:(
customer_reviews.text: Great product, heavy duty , best thing made in USA
customer_reviews.author: Rogelio Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, simalir to the one that my parents had, would highly recommend. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: john j.

customer_reviews.title: Great Dethatching Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have purchased. After 25 years my first one finally rusted through!
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for small lawns
customer_reviews.text: Great invention. Does it job good but requires a lot of physical work. If you have a small lawn it is perfect for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sandeep Barakoti

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I have a small back yard. This tool is enough for me instead of expensive eletronic tool.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Abbos

customer_reviews.title: Nice rake. Sturdy. Does good job
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. Easy to use. Picks up dead grass with some effort. Easy to clear grass from blades.
customer_reviews.author: DCHASS

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: I tried both sides and both sides tore up the lawn exposing the soil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great hand tool
customer_reviews.text: Best hand tool for dethatching your lawn. I have used it in areas that have been overtaken by moss. If you have a large yard, you may be better off renting a dethatching machine.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Bare spots disappearing now!
customer_reviews.text: Must be hardy to use. Waited till after good hard freeze this fall. Much easier then.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Thatch Rake
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, but a lot of hard work if you have a medium to large size yard.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Z.

customer_reviews.title: Does manual labor sound like fun?
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and buy a Sun Joe dethatcher. I promise you, you will thank me later. This rake works just fine...if you like to do a 15 minute job in about 2 hours or more. You’ve been warned.
customer_reviews.author: P. Yager

customer_reviews.title: Ames for the win!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. It is built well and does a fantastic job removing the dead layer anything else that is on the ground that does not belong (pine cones/needles and twigs). Added bonus, good exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Pharmboy34

customer_reviews.title: Great for standard and small lawns
customer_reviews.text: Used this to dethatch my lawn. Works well and removes a lot of thatch. Also gives a good workout. Would not recommend manually dethatching for large lawns. Just rent something automatic or hire someone.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: It only worked for 5mins before completely falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first 5 mins..after that it fell apart. Blade fell off, rubber on tip fell off. Box was destroyed on arrival so maybe it was a return.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: This works great on thick dry grass. Also on top soil , that is going to be seeded.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I love how sturdy and well made this item is. easy to use and really gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Too bad my whole front yard was weeds.. made for a very tough job. This thing pulls weeds but leaves the good grass.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: It does the job as expected but it takes time. Great for smaller yards.
customer_reviews.author: Reynold Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: If works very well, I recommend for small spaces, is a lot of physical work, try not to do it when is hot, the early the better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toolk
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm using medium back and forth motion.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H Chesney

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great product but after the first use the screws fell out. Easy to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P.

customer_reviews.title: Get ready for a de-thatching workout
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed, just not the right tool for a large lawn. Took me hours. Next year I will rent a gas-powered de-thatcher.
customer_reviews.author: Gery Armsby

customer_reviews.title: Use a powered dethatcher
customer_reviews.text: Get a power dethatcher It does the job but it's hard work.
customer_reviews.author: michael asamura

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but thatching is not nearly as easy as it looks
customer_reviews.text: Does the job but thatching is not nearly as easy as it looks. Do yourself a favor and rent a gas powered thatcher.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Good for small areas
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. Good for small areas, or places that are hard to get to with an auto dethatcher.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Good garden tool
customer_reviews.text: A good tool, does what it is made to do.
customer_reviews.author: The Iman

customer_reviews.title: Did the job.
customer_reviews.text: This really works and cleaning out the dead grass in your lawn before seeding and fertilizing. does require some muscle though.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Gets dead grass totally out but with the grass I have it took muscle to remove
customer_reviews.author: the dream

product_meta.title: AMES 2915100 Adjustable Self-Cleaning Thatch Rake with Hardwood Handle, 61-Inch
product_meta.description: The Ames Thatching rake is an all-purpose lawn rake. The curved tines are designed to clear dead grass clippings (thatch) from the lawn. This will allow air, sunshine, water, and fertilizers in to keep the grass healthy.
feature_bullets: Curved tines are designed to clear dead grass clippings
10-Inch end grip adds comfort and control
Hardwood handle for strength and durability

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars298 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
